section.title: Interface Portlets
section.para: These Portlets constitute the interface of the Portal. GateIn Portal consists of the following Interface Portlets:

section.title: Banner Portlet
section.para: This Portlet is considered as the welcome gateway of a Portal. It contains the organization's slogan, logo, icon, button, etc.

section.title: Breadcumbs Portlet
section.para: This Portlet is used to display the path of the selected page from Navigation.

section.title: Footer Portlet
section.para: This Portlet provides the footer for a site. Footer can be a text, images that are displayed at the bottom of a web site. It provides information about author/institutional sponsor, revision date, copyright, comments form, and navigational links.

section.title: HomePage Portlet
section.para: This Portlet is used to provide a home page for a portal. The home page is a main page displayed firstly when you visit the site.

section.title: Iframe Portlet
section.para: This Portlet is used to create IFrame elements for a site. Iframe is a HTML element which can embed a document into a HTML document. So embedded data is displayed inside a sub window of browser window.

section.title: Navigation Portlet
section.para: This Portlet provides a navigation bar. A navigation likes a menu that helps users to visualize the structure of a site and provide links to quickly move from page to page.

section.title: Sitemap Portlet
section.para: This Portlet is used to provide a site map page of a web site. It lists pages on a website, typically organized in hierarchical fashion.

section.title: Web Explorer Portlet
section.para: This Portlet provides web-browser for users. It allows users to connect to other sites over Internet.

section.title: Dashboard Portlet
section.para: This portlet is used for hosting mini - applications known as gadgets. The dashboard uses a variety of graphical effects for displaying, opening, and using gadgets.
See more details in Dashboard Portlet

section.title: Gadget Wrapper Portlet
section.para: This Portlet allows users to view a gadget in canvas mode.

section.title: FCK editor Portlet
section.para: All its common used functions (like Word editor) such as writing, formatting text, creating tables, inserting links or picture, etc.
See more details in FCK Portlet
